text.0: she hath shone brightly like a youthful woman stirring to motion every living creature.
text.1: agni hath come to feed on mortal fuel she hath made light and chased away the darkness.
text.2: turned to this all farspreading she hath risen and shone in brightness with white robes about her.
text.3: she hath beamed forth lovely with golden colours mother of kine guide of the days she bringeth.
text.4: bearing the gods own eye auspicious lady leading her courser white and fair to look on.
text.5: distinguished by her beanis dawn shines apparent come forth to all the world with wondrous treasure.
text.6: draw nigh with wealth and dawn away the foeman prepare for us wide pasture free from danger.
text.7: drive away those who hate us bring us riches pour bounty opulent lady on the singer.
text.8: send thy most excellent beams to shine and light us giving us lengthened days o dawn o goddess.
text.9: granting us food thou who hast all things precious and bounty rich in chariots kine and horses.
text.10: o uṣas noblyborn daughter of heaven whom the vasisthas with their hymns make mighty.
text.11: bestow thou on us vast and glorious riches preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
